definitions: A business strategy where a company hires external personnel on a temporary basis to supplement their existing in-house teams.
A service provided by an external vendor that supplies skilled workers to a client company to fill specific roles or projects, often for a defined period.
examples: Many tech companies utilize staff augmentation service to scale their development teams quickly.
The project manager recommended a staff augmentation service to bring in specialized cybersecurity experts.
Our company saved costs by using a staff augmentation service instead of hiring full-time employees for a short-term project.
